name: INDUSTRIAL :: STEAMPUNK SIGNATURE - Artefact

- 'SLOW/FAST' indicator, for adjusting the rate/speed of the balance wheel, for more accuracy 

- These mechanisms were built from a scientific aspect - from the engineer's perspective, but more intriguingly, artistically crafted at the same time.. creating a blend of both Form and Function 

- Brass dual-wing is set atop the main barrel

- Old gold.. aged from the numerous decades and naturally patinated

name: INDUSTRIAL :: MECHANICAL MEMOIRS - 1920's Art Deco Premium Cufflinks

- Swiss-made mechanisms, dating back from the 1910-20's

- These two pieces carries slightly varying levels of age and wear. One piece is slightly shinier than the other, which is brassier. An 'irregular symmetry'.

- Distinctive (and rare) 'blue crown', with two jewels set atop each winder. This was intensely difficult to source two the same!

- Beautifully weathered movements, with details extremely well preserved.. aged to perfection

- Premium Sterling Silver (925) toggle links

- Irregularly matched jewels - one containing 15 and its partner containing 17. These 'jewels' or rubies were inset as friction reducing points to allow smoother running and better accuracy. 

- Partially plated over the cogwork is part of the original 'Incabloc' shock-resistance feature. As these plates hold the more sensitive components firmer, allowing more of a solid running watch.

- Supremely scarce mechanism to find, with such intactness and originality.. whilst the difficulty was finding the two to match, with the same patina patterns..

- Approx. 24mm wide, and 14mm tall, EXCLUDING the winders

name: INDUSTRIAL :: RAW AESTHETIC - Organic & Ornate
description:
- Pocket-watch mechanisms with original porcelain dials, with perfectly-preserved porcelain dials - all intact!

- Roughly from the late 1800's to the 1920-30's

- Elaborate polishing on each piece, with individual styling 

- Please refer to SECOND image for code - H.1; E.1; W.1, and opt in the drop-down menu for specific piece!


- H.1 is cut very organically, with three distinctive 'bridges' along the left-side - these structures were very typical for antique pocket watches. The (porcelain) dial side is styled with italicised Arabic numerals. Also is an recessed circular portion, for the center-second hand. This piece measures approx. 28mm diameter

- E.1 has a particular 'swirling' polish atop the two main cogs, named 'Sunburst polishing', which gives the piece a multi-dimensional surface, and urges the user to rotate the mechanism in varying angles, to catch light. Manufacture is Elgin, from Illinois. The dial-side is printed with Arabic numerals, and an outer ring of seconds, in red. This piece measures approx. 29mm diameter

- W.1's unique look is the 'three-quarter plating' that covers said amount of the mechanism, mainly for shock-protection. As this 'sandwiches' the internal cog-work it creates a 'masked' effect, and thus allows a canvas for a myriad of polishing and engraving opportunities. It's polished with a 'Geneva Stripes' - the wave-like polishing (purely for aesthetics) created by watchmakers, for higher-grade mechanisms. The dial-side is adorned with a classical condensed Roman numerals, with an outer seconds-ring in red. This piece measures approx. 29mm

Any further questions about each, or any of the above pieces, please feel free to email @ ahwstudio@gmail.com

▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒

Unique, Intricate and Experimental STEAMPUNK / GOTHIC / INDUSTRIAL / NEO VICTORIAN STYLE WEARABLE JEWELRY

Distinctively shaped vintage Swiss watch mechanism revived from past decades (approximately the 1920's to the 50's).

Transformed into a unique mechanical art-piece, a majority of the parts had been disassembled to reveal an intricate level of detail and layering beneath the case - naturally aged and weathered.

Components like the gold cogs were re-assembled from completely different watches, to refill and balance the piece.

The centre of attention in this ring is the only element that is not man-made.. The Opal possesses beautiful rivers of colour running through the centre, and displays a spectrum of contrast, against the otherwise "dulled" watch.

The timepiece is originally a Croydon Watch.

Mounted on an adjustable Antique Silver filigree ring base - fully adjustable. Please note size needed!

Highly detailed and a unique one-off piece.

Size approx: 24mm x 15mm mechanism.

description:
▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒

Unique, Intricate, INDUSTRIAL WEARABLE JEWELRY

These unique cufflinks features a matching pair of vintage Swiss-made WITTNAUER watch movements, revived from approximately the 1940's.

Vintage stainless steel in a medium polish, gold lettering and detailing, and *seventeen jewels (synthetic rubies)*. 

Beveled on several angles including the top and bottom of the plates, and the main gears - this made the piece more angular and dynamic in aesthetics, for a brilliant light-catching sheen.

The original winder (crown) is still intact. This was many times more difficult to find a double of!

Suitable for a varying spectrum of shirts with its neutral tones. Great for dressy occasions.

*Jewels inside a watch were synthetic rubies, and were added to all mechanical watches for the purpose of friction-reduction. As the watch ran for long periods of time, it cut down the wear on the inside of the axle of each cog.*

The perfect masculine accessory for a French-Cuff shirt - a bold outstanding piece suitable on both light and dark French-Cuffs. 
From beautiful aged, weathered looks, to contemporary polishes and finishes.

Size approx: 15x18mm watch piece.


▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒

Unique, Intricate and Experimental STEAMPUNK / GOTHIC / INDUSTRIAL / NEO VICTORIAN STYLE WEARABLE JEWELRY

Using a unique blend of a vintage "SANDOZ" Swiss-Made watch mechanism in STAINLESS STEEL, embedded in a polished 925 Sterling Silver ring. The adjustable ring is welded into the exhibition case, in which is holding the stainless steel mechanism.

Sandoz was founded in the 1870's by Henri Frédéric Sandoz, later producing complicated watches under the name of CYMA - a watch brand a fair few of your grandparents/parents may be more familiar with. This piece is stamped with a green emblem and insignia.

"Seventeen Jewels" indicates that there are seventeen tiny little synthetic rubies - which acts as bearings embedded within the mechanism. These are originally set by the watchmaker.

Embedded with intricate layering of gears, simple to wear and adjust. Suitable for both casual and formal wear. Fits most sizes.

Mechanism size is approx: 25mm diameter.
